newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia sells HRK70 mln 91-day T-bills, rate falls.
newsitem.headline: Croatia sells HRK70 mln 91-day T-bills, rate falls.

text.p: Croatia's Finance Ministry said on Tuesday it raised 70 million kuna through 91-day treasury bills at an auction.
Bids totalled 75 million kuna, overshooting the target by 25 million, the ministry said in a press release.
The entire issue went to the banking sector.
It was priced at 97.213 percent, compared to 97.095 percent three weeks ago. The interest rate fell to 11.50 from 12 percent. Full details are available on page MFHT.
Bills are payable in two days and they mature on July 10.

The ministry said it would next auction 120 million kuna worth of 42-day T-bills on April 15. Foreign investors can participate by placing their bids with Croatian banks. -- Kolumbina Bencevic, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
